history.content:
Berkeley lol

Source: I got in with similar background this year

children.subject: Different anon who got into 5th year program. Yes you wanna have an advisor who wants to do research for you, and if possible you want to start working with them before you apply so you can write about work you have started with them and what you plan to work on during masters.
<md>I also got into the 5th year. Pretty sure that it is required to have an advisor to write you a letter of req</md>
When did you start working with them?
<md>I started working with them in the fall. I did research beforehand in a different lab as well. </md>
did you need to know your advisor before applying? I heard that helps
Are there any easier, but still not-too-bad, schools to get into? I don't think I stand a chance at getting into the big names without research lol, I was looking for some hidden gems instead.

history.content: Are there any Masters programs around the country (either MEng or MS in CS), that one has a decent chance of getting into if one only has work experience (internships), good GPA and good GRE scores, but not any significant research experience nor TA experience? I know Letters of Recommendation are usually very important, so it's obviously really helpful to have done research and/or been a TA so that one can get a LoR from the research advisor and/or from the professor one taught under, but I'm wondering if it is possible to get into a Masters program that is worth anything without having either of these experiences under one's belt. Looking to hear any relevant anecdotes and/or a few college names that have accepted students like this.
history.subject: Masters Programs
